history.content: Jumping off the waitlist and attempting to re-add the class will do nothing other than put you at the very end of the waitlist. It is not a good idea.

children.subject:
I'm not on facebook but in my experience the only circumstance in which this might be helpful is if your status changes after you first placed yourself on the waitlist for a class that was never full.  For example, if your major declaration to become a CS major was made official and there are spots for cs majors which you weren't when you first joined the waitlist.

If you have other experiences and are willing to come out of anonymity, so that I can verify, that would be great.
Here is a screenshot of the Facebook post referenced above:

Why do just declared L&S CS majors have to drop a non-full upper-division CS class they are waitlisted in to get into the class?

Shouldn't the system handle that automatically?

Students run the risk of losing their position on the waitlist if the class doesn't have space in their enrollment category after they drop it.
Students don't.  They just need to wait until staff is in the office after the holiday break so enrollments can be processed.

Bearfacts says a student is a declared CS major. Is it true that Telebears doesn't recognize that declaration by automatically enrolling the student into the class? So Bearfacts and Telebears are on different systems, and staff have to sync them together to process enrollments?
I think that it's more that the waitlist is a manual waitlist, so Telebears doesn't automatically enroll anyone. If it was an automatic waitlist, it would indeed do so.
It seems like it isn't just a manual waitlist because the students in the Facebook thread got in immediately after they dropped the class and readded it?

Getting declared CS doesn't flip a switch somewhere that enrolls you in any class for which 1) you're waitlisted and 2) there are open seats for CS majors with your class standing. Telebears doesn't work that way  (and it's probably harder to configure it to do so than for staff to do it themselves).

When you add a class on Telebears, it checks to see if there are seats available in your enrollment category, and if not, you're redirected to the waitlist (or not, if the waitlist is full). That has nothing to do with the method by which people are taken off the waitlist, which is what the automatic/manual distinction refers to.

I think a solution to people gaming the system like this (and I don't really blame them, though it does make me sad for the people staying on the waitlist or not in the know) would be to hold off on declaring people at the end of the semester until the staff have processed all the applications. Once the applications have all (or almost all) been decided on, the accepted students should be manually enrolled in the relevant CS upper divs, following policy, and only after that should students be declared. I don't think this puts the declared students at much of a disadvantage, as this usually happens when most people don't make many changes to their schedule (e.g. early January, late May); summer applications are an exception. I don't know how logistically difficult this is, though.

history.content: From schedule.berkeley.edu, CS189 enrollment is now 'OPEN' for seniors. I am not sure what it means, would I be able to get in the class directly if I jump out of waitlist and add the class again now? (I have senior status)
history.subject: CS189 enrollment
